meanings.definition: Attempt to sell (something), typically by pestering people in an aggressive or bold manner.
meanings.sent1: The salesman would tout his products loudly at the market.
meanings.sent2: She decided to tout her handmade jewelry at the craft fair.
meanings.sent3: The persistent tout kept trying to sell umbrellas on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: He would tout his skills as a chef to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent5: The street performer would tout his talents with a loud voice and a big smile.

meanings.definition: Advertise in a boastful or aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: The company would tout their new product as the best on the market.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often tout their achievements during election campaigns.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant owner would tout his famous dessert to every customer.
meanings.sent4: The singer would tout her upcoming concert with flashy posters.
meanings.sent5: The car dealership would tout their amazing deals in every advertisement.

meanings.definition: A person who solicits business or employment in a persistent or annoying way.
meanings.sent1: The street tout kept approaching passersby to offer tour packages.
meanings.sent2: The persistent tout outside the store was trying to sell magazine subscriptions.
meanings.sent3: The annoying tout kept asking for donations even after being declined.
meanings.sent4: The job fair was filled with eager touts looking for employment opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The persistent tout at the event was handing out flyers to everyone passing by.
